<gallery>
Fichier:Syphilis chancre LISA.jpg|alt=The description: single, clean-bottomed, painless and indurated is not always de rigueur. Here the background is fibrinous. Any ulceration of the genitals is syphilis until proven otherwise.|Syphilitic chancre: painless ulceration opposite the frenulum of the penis.
</gallery>

question.question: Which of the following is a characteristic feature of a primary syphilis chancre?
question.option_a: It is always painful and accompanied by severe itching.
question.option_b: It typically has a clean, smooth base and is painless.
question.option_c: It is usually accompanied by a high fever and swollen lymph nodes.
question.option_d: It often appears as multiple, small, and painful ulcers.
